name: Pigeon Pose
setup: Start in tabletop or downward dog position
Bring one knee forward toward same-side hand
Slide foot across toward opposite hip (shin roughly parallel to front of mat)
Extend back leg straight behind, toes pointed or top of foot down
steps: Square hips toward front of mat
Walk hands forward and lower torso over front leg
Rest on forearms or fold fully over front shin
Breathe deeply and relax into the stretch
Hold for prescribed time, then switch sides
cues: Keep front shin roughly parallel to mat edge
mistakes: Hips twisted or rotated instead of squared
safety: If knee feels tweaky, reduce angle of front shin or place a block/blanket under hip. Avoid this pose if experiencing acute knee or hip pain.

regressions: Seated pigeon (sitting in chair, ankle on opposite knee)
progressions: Full pigeon with quad stretch (reaching back for back foot)

prescriptionHints.notes: Hold 60-120s per side. Excellent for hip mobility and glute stretch. Use props as needed.

joints.notes: Keep front knee safe by adjusting shin angle. Don't force depth; allow hips to open gradually over time.
